## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
wind_speeds_full <- c(8.9, 12.4, 8.6, 11.3, 9.2, 8.8, 35.1, 6.2, 7.0, 7.1, 11.8, 10.7, 7.6, 9.1, 9.2, 8.2, 9.0, 8.7, 9.1, 10.9, 10.3, 9.6, 7.8, 11.5, 9.3, 7.9, 8.8, 8.8, 12.7, 8.4, 7.8, 5.7, 10.5, 10.5, 9.6, 8.9, 10.2, 10.3, 7.7, 10.6, 8.3, 8.8, 9.5, 8.8, 9.4)

# Set up class boundaries to cover the full range (min = 5.7, max = 35.1)
# Use a reasonable bin width, e.g., 5 mph, to accommodate the outlier
breaks <- seq(1, 40, by=1)

# Create a relative frequency histogram
hist_data <- hist(wind_speeds_full, breaks=breaks, plot=FALSE)  # Compute histogram data
rel_freq <- hist_data$counts / length(wind_speeds_full)  # Calculate relative frequencies

# Plot the histogram
barplot(rel_freq, names.arg=hist_data$mids, space=0, 
        main="Relative Frequency Histogram of Wind Speeds (Including 35.1)", 
        xlab="Wind Speed (mph)", ylab="Relative Frequency", col="lightblue")
```
